newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: S.Lanka '97 inflation seen lower at 8-9 pct.
newsitem.headline: S.Lanka '97 inflation seen lower at 8-9 pct.

text.p: Sri Lanka's Central Bank governor said on Friday that he expected average annual inflation in 1997 to be lower at between eight and nine percent against 15.9 last year.
"The moving average should be around 8-9 percent," Amarananda Jayawardena told Reuters in an interview.
He said inflation rose sharply last year after the government reduced its administered prices, mainly the subsidy on wheat flour.

"Our concern now is whether the increase in credit and large capital inflows will tend to reignite inflationary pressures. But we are keeping a watch on the situation and the present level of credit expansion does not indicate an explosive growth," he said.
